A Cog In the Cosmic Machine

Role: Engine Programmer

Fall 2020 - May 2021

Project Highlights

  • Integrated the narrative writing tool INK with custom code
  • Developed the system which managed all in-game narrative events
  • Trained all team members in custom event implementation tools
  • Designed and iterated a specialized interface for game event creation
  • Organized meetings between team disciplines to develop and iterate new features

Narrative Integration

My primary task on this project was to combine programmatic efforts in Unity with the interactive story software called INK. All of the game's text was composed within INK, and subsequently read and printed to a Driver script I wrote.

Every aspect of narrative events in the game, including player choices, narrative branching, and the various methods by which the narrative affected gameplay were integrated by myself.

As shown in this gif, I worked to ensure that all transitions between gameplay and narrative were both seamless and satisfying. No choice is forgotten, and all individual events are tracked for a stellar experience.

Narrative Integration

I led the creation of an interface that allowed the design team to implement events without needing to delve into the game's underlying code.

All necessary aspects of an event's creation are included, such as images, music, available choices for every story segment, and how player stats are altered or required by an event.

INK, the program we used to create the game's story, was not innately compatible with anything besides reading out the choices that a player made. As such, I devised clever solutions to further link Unity with INK and ultimately met every challenge that the game required.
